channel.title: If marijuana were to be legalized, would the price fall sharply?
channel.description:
I was thinking - If marijuana was to be legalized, wouldn't the price go way down?
I'm not sure whats harder to grow - tobacco or marijuana. Average tobacco is about 20$ a pound. A pound. Do you guys think the price would fall a lot because of competition/legalization, like to 1$ a gram?

item.title: If marijuana were to be legalized, would the price fall sharply?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:12, topic:315108”]They wouldn’t lower prices though. Drug dealing is an incredibly risky industry, the only thing that makes it worth the risk is the immense markup on the product. There would be no point undercutting legit dealers to risk life in prison.

Don’t see that many moonshine dealers around anymore, do you? :P[/quote]In sweden you do!

Read full topic
item.source: If marijuana were to be legalized, would the price fall sharply?

item.title: If marijuana were to be legalized, would the price fall sharply?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:9, topic:315108”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=411543.msg3036865#msg3036865 date=1258832475]

[quote author=Andrew link=topic=411543.msg3035241#msg3035241 date=1258683688]
I was thinking - If marijuana was to be legalized, wouldn’t the price go way down?

I’m not sure whats harder to grow - tobacco or marijuana.
Average tobacco is about 20$ a pound. A pound.
Do you guys think the price would fall a lot because of competition/legalization, like to 1$ a gram?
[/quote]I think they would keep it moderately high. If they have a chance to get a large profit, they will. Mids are what, like ~$10 a gram? And ounce varies 90 - 100 depending on the grade. I don’t think they’re going to go as radical as %90 lower.

By the way, if marijuana was legalized I’m positive that at any given price, tobacco wouldn’t compete with it.
[/quote]wtf you can get an ounce ranging between $90-100 yet 1/28th is $10? impossibleee

The regular price for a half ounce around here is ~$80-100 ($10/g ofc) :S[/quote]I said $10 for a gram not an eighth. I guess it all depends on where you get it from, because around here it is about 90-100 for an ounce.

Read full topic
item.source: If marijuana were to be legalized, would the price fall sharply?

item.title: If marijuana were to be legalized, would the price fall sharply?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

They wouldn’t lower prices though. Drug dealing is an incredibly risky industry, the only thing that makes it worth the risk is the immense markup on the product. There would be no point undercutting legit dealers to risk life in prison.

Don’t see that many moonshine dealers around anymore, do you?

Read full topic
item.source: If marijuana were to be legalized, would the price fall sharply?

item.title: If marijuana were to be legalized, would the price fall sharply?
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

I do see a possibility where the price would fall. Drug traffickers would still want a part of the profit on weed, I could see them charging competitively with legal dealers. They could lower prices as much as they want, as opposed to the legal retailers who have to make their prices accommodate federal law. If we saw a price drop, it would be from the traffickers who do not want to lose their profit.

Read full topic
item.source: If marijuana were to be legalized, would the price fall sharply?

I’m not sure whats harder to grow - tobacco or marijuana.
Average tobacco is about 20$ a pound. A pound.
Do you guys think the price would fall a lot because of competition/legalization, like to 1$ a gram?
[/quote]I think they would keep it moderately high. If they have a chance to get a large profit, they will. Mids are what, like ~$10 a gram? And ounce varies 90 - 100 depending on the grade. I don’t think they’re going to go as radical as %90 lower.

[/quote]wtf you can get an ounce ranging between $90-100 yet 1/28th is $10? impossibleee

The regular price for a half ounce around here is ~$80-100 ($10/g ofc) :S[/quote]
What kind? I heard ditch is really cheap… But Albino, and what ever other types are expensive… I don’t smoke it so I really don’t know.

item.title: If marijuana were to be legalized, would the price fall sharply?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

probably not, im sure big dealers have something planned already in the case that it ever gets legalized

edit: in further thinking chances are there would be some monopoly on selling it so dealers would still be able to make money, though the price would drop a bit

Read full topic

Do you guys think the price would fall a lot because of competition/legalization, like to 1$ a gram?[/quote]I think they would keep it moderately high. If they have a chance to get a large profit, they will. Mids are what, like ~$10 a gram? And ounce varies 90 - 100 depending on the grade. I don’t think they’re going to go as radical as %90 lower.

item.title: If marijuana were to be legalized, would the price fall sharply?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

But… anyone can grow it easily now…

The name “weed” is not a coincidence. Chuck some seeds in a pot, they’ll grow. Anything else is just increasing potency.

Read full topic
item.source: If marijuana were to be legalized, would the price fall sharply?

item.title: If marijuana were to be legalized, would the price fall sharply?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Andrew:

I’m not sure whats harder to grow - tobacco or marijuana.

Tobacco is by far harder to grow than marijuana. I’ve never grown either, but I know that marijuana used to grow around where I live naturally when the Indians lived here from history books. (the Indians were ran out of Ohio by the Americans around 1815 or so) So I would say that it will never be legalized because of the sheer fact that anyone can grow it easily and it therefore couldn’t be taxed by the government.

Read full topic
item.source: If marijuana were to be legalized, would the price fall sharply?
